title: Downloaded Solidity by hardhat does not have `kall`, causing compilation errors

labels.name: C-meta
labels.description: Category: Meta discussion about this repository, git hygiene, issues, etc

body:
I'm experiencing this issue on [PR 579](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/579) / Commit [35cb48d](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/commit/35cb48d32d63a838079ae3d9152174b1c394309a). 

## What I'm doing: 

### Locally:

1. I check out my branch.
2. It has new dependency ([just OZ contract](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/579/files#diff-ebaa48c3dfa5e3d13db1ec0d4053e23f01f6c4fd8e07606f4e426495412300a3R51)) so I run `yarn && yarn build && ` in the root. It works.

### In CI

I see two errors on the [build step](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/runs/2457342003?check_suite_focus=true).

First: 
```
lerna ERR! yarn run build stderr:
Error HH503: Couldn't download compiler version 0.7.6. Checksum verification failed. Please check your connection.
For more info go to https://hardhat.org/HH503 or run Hardhat with --show-stack-traces
```

Second:
```
contracts/optimistic-ethereum/libraries/wrappers/Lib_ExecutionManagerWrapper.sol:143:13: DeclarationError: Function not found.
            kall(add(_calldata, 0x20), mload(_calldata), 0x0, 0x0)
            ^--^=
```

Not sure why you're getting the `kall` error, maybe @ben-chain knows? The checksum verification error is a weird one, maybe related to https://github.com/nomiclabs/hardhat/issues/1332#issuecomment-818212424? Can you try rebasing your branch to master? We recently updated hardhat.
I'm seeing that error locally as well!

I've seen this recently too and have downloaded the logs from a failing CI run for the developer tackling this issue to use for debugging purposes. I _think_ there is some issue with the endpoint hosting the latest compiler version? It may be unreliable? Not quite sure.
[logs_5044.zip](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/files/6394391/logs_5044.zip)
Can this be P-high? Literally cannot test locally rn ðŸ˜…
Latest master has the fix I believe. Let's merge the versioning PR to get new packages out @snario
Fixed in https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/668

@snario @gakonst Still seeing this issue after pulling from main:

```
 > [stage-3 8/9] RUN yarn build:                                                                                                                                                                                                               

...

#29 34.09 contracts/optimistic-ethereum/libraries/wrappers/Lib_ExecutionManagerWrapper.sol:143:13: DeclarationError: Function not found.
#29 34.09             kall(add(_calldata, 0x20), mload(_calldata), 0x0, 0x0)
#29 34.09             ^--^
#29 34.09 
#29 34.09 contracts/optimistic-ethereum/OVM/bridge/tokens/OVM_L1ETHGateway.sol:41:5: Warning: Visibility for constructor is ignored. If you want the contract to be non-deployable, making it "abstract" is sufficient.
#29 34.09     constructor()
#29 34.09     ^ (Relevant source part starts here and spans across multiple lines).
#29 34.09 
#29 34.09 
#29 34.09 Error HH600: Compilation failed
#29 34.09 HardhatError: HH600: Compilation failed
#29 34.09     at SimpleTaskDefinition.action (/optimism/node_modules/hardhat/src/builtin-tasks/compile.ts:751:15)
#29 34.09     at Environment._runTaskDefinition (/optimism/node_modules/hardhat/src/internal/core/runtime-environment.ts:217:14)
#29 34.09     at Environment.run (/optimism/node_modules/hardhat/src/internal/core/runtime-environment.ts:129:14)
#29 34.09     at SimpleTaskDefinition.action (/optimism/node_modules/hardhat/src/builtin-tasks/compile.ts:973:7)
#29 34.09     at Environment._runTaskDefinition (/optimism/node_modules/hardhat/src/internal/core/runtime-environment.ts:217:14)
#29 34.09     at Environment.run (/optimism/node_modules/hardhat/src/internal/core/runtime-environment.ts:129:14)
#29 34.09     at SimpleTaskDefinition.action (/optimism/node_modules/hardhat/src/builtin-tasks/compile.ts:395:45)
#29 34.09     at Environment._runTaskDefinition (/optimism/node_modules/hardhat/src/internal/core/runtime-environment.ts:217:14)
#29 34.09     at Environment.run (/optimism/node_modules/hardhat/src/internal/core/runtime-environment.ts:129:14)
#29 34.09     at SimpleTaskDefinition.action (/optimism/node_modules/hardhat/src/builtin-tasks/compile.ts:1320:63)
#29 34.09     at Environment._runTaskDefinition (/optimism/node_modules/hardhat/src/internal/core/runtime-environment.ts:217:14)
#29 34.09     at Environment.run (/optimism/node_modules/hardhat/src/internal/core/runtime-environment.ts:129:14)
#29 34.09     at SimpleTaskDefinition.action (/optimism/node_modules/hardhat/src/builtin-tasks/compile.ts:1390:7)
#29 34.09     at Environment._runTaskDefinition (/optimism/node_modules/hardhat/src/internal/core/runtime-environment.ts:217:14)
#29 34.09     at OverriddenTaskDefinition._action (/optimism/node_modules/@typechain/hardhat/src/index.ts:28:5)
#29 34.09     at Environment._runTaskDefinition (/optimism/node_modules/hardhat/src/internal/core/runtime-environment.ts:217:14)
#29 34.09 error Command failed with exit code 1.
#29 34.09 error Command failed with exit code 1.
#29 34.09 lerna ERR! yarn run build exited 1 in '@eth-optimism/contracts'
#29 34.10 error Command failed with exit code 1.
#29 34.10 info Visit https://yarnpkg.com/en/docs/cli/run for documentation about this command.
#29 34.12 error Command failed with exit code 1.
#29 34.12 info Visit https://yarnpkg.com/en/docs/cli/run for documentation about this command.
------
executor failed running [/bin/sh -c yarn build]: exit code: 1
ERROR: Service 'builder' failed to build
```

Looks like the download compiler issue is fixed, but the `kall` issue remains.
Hm. Re-opening and renaming.
I think this error happens because it tries to use the EVM Compiler (0.7.6) instead of the OVM compiler. It makes sense that `kall` would not be found if so.

> I think this error happens because it tries to use the EVM Compiler (0.7.6) instead of the OVM compiler. It makes sense that `kall` would not be found if so.

Seems like it.

The logs show

```
#29 42.50 $ ./scripts/build.sh
#29 42.50 $ tsc -p ./tsconfig.build.json
#29 42.50 $ hardhat compile --show-stack-traces
#29 42.50 Compiling 97 files with 0.7.6
```

I have been looking into this for the past day and it's really stumping me, really sorry for the interruption to service @TransmissionsDev !  To confirm -- are you still getting this in the monorepo?  If it's only on your local dev environment, can you try putting [this version](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/blob/4837aaed3fe10ea515c3bc6685d506a13b382f8e/packages/contracts/hardhat.config.ts#L56) into your `hardhat.config.ts` and tell me if it goes away?

> I have been looking into this for the past day and it's really stumping me, really sorry for the interruption to service @TransmissionsDev ! To confirm -- are you still getting this in the monorepo? If it's only on your local dev environment, can you try putting [this version](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/blob/4837aaed3fe10ea515c3bc6685d506a13b382f8e/packages/contracts/hardhat.config.ts#L56) into your `hardhat.config.ts` and tell me if it goes away?

Yep still getting this. Already have that version in my `hardhat.config.ts`.

The weirdest part is that if I run ./scripts/build.sh myself I don't see this problem. But if immediately after I try to run `docker-compose up` in `ops` I continue to see the same error.

Could this be related to my docker-compose and docker versions?

```
benmayer@Bens-MacBook-Pro Desktop % docker -v
Docker version 20.10.5, build 55c4c88
benmayer@Bens-MacBook-Pro Desktop % docker-compose -v
docker-compose version 1.29.0, build 07737305
```

What versions do you guys use?

Hmmm, I'm on the same versions.  Would you be able to try a `docker system prune` or something of the sort?  This feels like it may be a cached version being held on in docker that is not up to date with `solc-bin`

@TransmissionsDev I am pretty sure at this point that this is a caching issue with the docker build.  Specifically, we have local logic which checks if the `soljson.js` has been changed in the hardhat compiler.  However, `docker build` will bypass this if it does not see changes to the filesystem.  So, if you delete all the images where this build might be cached, forcing the OVM compiler to be downloaded, I think this should go away. ðŸ¤ž

edit: Another command I am testing out is just `docker-compose build --no-cache` which may be an easier way to do it

@TransmissionsDev plz try nuking the monorepo if you can do that without losing any work. We added cache invalidation in a recent version of `hardhat-ovm` that will probably solve this. If still doesn't work after doing that, lemme know.
In particular, ensure you rebuild the (untagged) `builder` image.
Will give this a shot rn. I tried nuking (rm -rf) and running `docker system prune -a` earlier but that broke even more stuff lmao, going to try restarting my laptop too.

Wtf lol

Nuking and pruning now breaks the builder, dtl, batch_submitter and relayer.

https://gist.github.com/TransmissionsDev/18a87aa62f4ff4e9461505484ae0588f

Here's me trying to build again: 

https://gist.github.com/TransmissionsDev/97aad46dec69dbf3a864774367a15c0d
Unfortunately nuking and rebuilding still results in the same error with `kall` not found.

Confirmed with Ale from Synthetix that this issue with `kall` still occurs on a fresh clone, yarn install and build, and build of the docker containers of the monorepo.

@ben-chain @snario @tynes Are there any updates on a fix for this?

Hmmm, the compiler is absolutely updated by now, so this must be a caching issue where the old version is being held on to by docker.  @TransmissionsDev have you tried `docker-compose build --no-cache` since https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/723 was merged?

> Hmmm, the compiler is absolutely updated by now, so this must be a caching issue where the old version is being held on to by docker. @TransmissionsDev have you tried `docker-compose build --no-cache` since #723 was merged?

Yep even did a full `docker system prune -a` and nuked the repo and recloned :(
I can give you guys remote access to my laptop and you could try debugging that way? ðŸ˜‚
Is this an M1 issue?

> Is this an M1 issue?

that's some great intuition. Hadn't thought of that but it's possible.

I have a fresh M1 that I will go try this out on now.  I'm not sure if it'll be possible to replicate as it is almost certainly a caching issue, and I probably missed the window to have my machine cache the wrong thing, but worth a shot.  I'm really stumped by this.  We may need to just move to a new compiler version string which has not been used previously to get it working.
@bscarano if you get a chance, would you mind sharing if you are on an M1, and if `--no-cache` solves this for you? :)

@gakonst @ben-chain  confirmed with Ale from Synthetix that it's an issue on M1 macs only.
He tried his same setup on his old Intel mac and everything worked as expected
